trans-unit.source: Creates a new desktop, associates it with the current window station of the calling process

seg-source.mrk: Creates a new desktop, associates it with the current window station of the calling process

target.mrk: Creates a new desktop, associates it with the current window station of the calling process

trans-unit.source: The name of the desktop to be created. Desktop names are case-insensitive and may not contain backslash characters (\).

seg-source.mrk: The name of the desktop to be created.
Desktop names are case-insensitive and may not contain backslash characters (\).

target.mrk: The name of the desktop to be created.
Desktop names are case-insensitive and may not contain backslash characters (\).

trans-unit.source: [optional] The requested access to the desktop. This parameter can be one or more of the following values:

seg-source.mrk: The requested access to the desktop.
This parameter can be one or more of the following values:

target.mrk: The requested access to the desktop.
This parameter can be one or more of the following values:

trans-unit.source: [optional] The optional flags. It can be zero or the following value:

seg-source.mrk: It can be zero or the following value:

target.mrk: It can be zero or the following value:

trans-unit.source: [optional] The size of the desktop heap, in kilobytes. Default is 0.

seg-source.mrk: The size of the desktop heap, in kilobytes.

target.mrk: The size of the desktop heap, in kilobytes.

trans-unit.source: [optional] $tagSECURITY_ATTRIBUTES structure that determines whether the returned handle can be inherited by child processes.

seg-source.mrk: $tagSECURITY_ATTRIBUTES structure that determines whether the returned handle can be inherited by child processes.

target.mrk: $tagSECURITY_ATTRIBUTES structure that determines whether the returned handle can be inherited by child processes.

trans-unit.source: If this parameter is 0 (Default), the handle cannot be inherited .

seg-source.mrk: If this parameter is 0 (Default), the handle cannot be inherited .

target.mrk: If this parameter is 0 (Default), the handle cannot be inherited .

trans-unit.source: Handle to the newly created desktop. If the specified desktop already exists, the function succeeds and returns a handle to the existing desktop.

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the newly created desktop.
If the specified desktop already exists, the function succeeds and returns a handle to the existing desktop.

target.mrk: Handle to the newly created desktop.
If the specified desktop already exists, the function succeeds and returns a handle to the existing desktop.

trans-unit.source: 0, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information.

seg-source.mrk: 0, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information.

target.mrk: 0, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information.

trans-unit.source: The number of desktops that can be created is limited by the size of the system desktop heap.

seg-source.mrk: The number of desktops that can be created is limited by the size of the system desktop heap.

target.mrk: The number of desktops that can be created is limited by the size of the system desktop heap.

trans-unit.source: You can increase the number of desktops that can be created by increasing the size of the desktop heap or by reducing the default heap reserved for each desktop in the interactive window station.

seg-source.mrk: You can increase the number of desktops that can be created by increasing the size of the desktop heap or by reducing the default heap reserved for each desktop in the interactive window station.

target.mrk: You can increase the number of desktops that can be created by increasing the size of the desktop heap or by reducing the default heap reserved for each desktop in the interactive window station.

trans-unit.source: The default size of the desktop heap depends on factors such as hardware architecture.

seg-source.mrk: The default size of the desktop heap depends on factors such as hardware architecture.

target.mrk: The default size of the desktop heap depends on factors such as hardware architecture.

trans-unit.source: To retrieve the size of the heap, call the _WinAPI_GetUserObjectInformation() function with $UOI_HEAPSIZE.

seg-source.mrk: To retrieve the size of the heap, call the _WinAPI_GetUserObjectInformation() function with $UOI_HEAPSIZE.

target.mrk: To retrieve the size of the heap, call the _WinAPI_GetUserObjectInformation() function with $UOI_HEAPSIZE.

trans-unit.source: When you are finished using the desktop, call the _WinAPI_CloseDesktop() function to close it.

seg-source.mrk: When you are finished using the desktop, call the _WinAPI_CloseDesktop() function to close it.

target.mrk: When you are finished using the desktop, call the _WinAPI_CloseDesktop() function to close it.

trans-unit.source: Retrieve a handle to the current desktop and create a new desktop named "MyDesktop"

seg-source.mrk: Retrieve a handle to the current desktop and create a new desktop named "MyDesktop"

target.mrk: Retrieve a handle to the current desktop and create a new desktop named "MyDesktop"

trans-unit.source: Switch to the newly created desktop

seg-source.mrk: Switch to the newly created desktop

target.mrk: Switch to the newly created desktop

trans-unit.source: Run "calc.exe" on "MyDesktop" and wait until a process will not be closed by user

seg-source.mrk: Run "calc.exe" on "MyDesktop" and wait until a process will not be closed by user

target.mrk: Run "calc.exe" on "MyDesktop" and wait until a process will not be closed by user

trans-unit.source: Switch to previous desktop and close "MyDesktop"

seg-source.mrk: Switch to previous desktop and close "MyDesktop"

target.mrk: Switch to previous desktop and close "MyDesktop"

trans-unit.source: Free memory allocated for a string
